At that time, the first great minister of King Brahmadatta, from the Brahmin caste, heard that in this country there were a couple of beggars who wandered among humans, playing the qin and se, begging for their own livelihood. At that time, the first wife of the beggar was about to give birth. She had this thought in her mind and said to her husband:
I just had a thought. I wish to have the four types of troops surround me several times, to obtain a good tent to sleep in, and to wash the juice of a sharp sword to drink.

Her husband replied to his wife:
We two have been destroyed by Brahmadatta, losing our country. How can we prepare these four types of troops, and a good tent to wash the juice of a sharp sword?
His wife said to her husband:

Why do you still want to live?

At that time, the great minister summoned the beggar in front of him to play music. The sound matched the zither and the zither matched the sound. Sometimes the zither and sound were discordant, and the sound and zither were discordant. The great minister asked:
Observing your music, there is something unpleasant. Do you have an illness in your body?

My body has no suffering or illness, only something on my mind.
